727-214
IMPORTANT INFORMATION
FOR OUR 727-214 FANJET PASSENGERS
EMERGENCY EXITS
There are eight exits provided for your use. The chart below will
show you the one closest to your seat. The exits over the wings
are removable windows. The two exits forward and the two side
exits aft are doors which are equipped with fast operating
evacuation slides.

2002. 127.447

PSA
727
IMPORTANT INFORMATION
FOR OUR FANJET PASSENGERS
Even though you may be an experienced air
traveler, there are certain features of this air-
craft with which you may not be familiar.
AUTOMATIC OXYGEN SYSTEM
The higher altitudes at which this aircraft operates require the
prompt use of the automatic oxygen system in case of any
sudden change in cabin pressure. Should a decompression occur
oxygen masks will drop down. Pull nearest mask down to initiate
flow of oxygen and promptly place over nose and mouth. Adjust
headband. Breathe normally.
NO SMOKING
BREATHE
NORMALLY
FLOTATION EQUIPMENT
FORWARD
FACING
SEAT
BRACING POSITION
REAR
FACING
SEAT
In
the event of a water landing,
cushion may be used as an aid to
keep afloat. Grasp the cushion at the
rear, pull it forward and take it with
you. Place arms through straps on
bottom to retain cushion.
SEAT BELT
LIFT TO
RELEASE.
Even if the "SEAT BELT" sign is turned off in flight, it is recommended
that you keep your seat belt loosely fastened, whenever you are in your
seat.
PLEASE DO NOT REMOVE FROM AIRCRAFT
SEE REVERSE SIDE
2-4-11/75 Supersedes PSA17A
